valueProps.customer: Instant fraud protection with zero liability
valueProps.bmo: 98% automation rate reduces ops cost by $47 per case

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Hi Sarah, we noticed a $142 charge from 'Techtronix Store' on your card ending in 4892. Was this you?

conversation.speaker: user
conversation.text: No, I don't recognize it.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Got it — I'll block the transaction immediately and start a quick review.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Verified — this transaction qualifies for dispute under Visa Rule 4863. Proceeding with claim.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Policy confirmed — low-risk case, eligible for instant refund per regulatory guidelines.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: $142 has been credited back to your account. Your new card will arrive in 3 business days.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: I've automatically reconnected Netflix, Spotify, and your childcare payment to your new card.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Case closed ✅ This outcome has been added to our fraud prevention models to protect you better.

bmoConversation.speaker: user
bmoConversation.text: Show me the details on case #FR-2847 for Sarah Mitchell.

bmoConversation.speaker: agent
bmoConversation.text: Case FR-2847: Unauthorized $142 charge at Techtronix Store detected 11/06 at 14:23 EST. Card ending 4892. Geolocation mismatch — transaction in Dallas, customer home location Toronto. Velocity check passed. Merchant category: Electronics.

bmoConversation.speaker: agent
bmoConversation.text: Dispute valid under Visa Rule 4863 (Cardholder Does Not Recognize). KYC verified, account in good standing. Customer confirmed non-authorization within 2 hours of transaction. Zero prior disputes in 24 months. Recommendation: Approve instant provisional credit.

bmoConversation.speaker: user
bmoConversation.text: Any compliance flags I should know about?

bmoConversation.speaker: agent
bmoConversation.text: No flags. Transaction falls below high-value threshold ($500). Reg E zero liability applies. FCBA provisional credit timeline compliant (within 10 business days, we're at 2 hours). OCC audit trail complete. All disclosures sent to customer automatically.

bmoConversation.speaker: user
bmoConversation.text: Proceed with resolution. What's the full action plan?

bmoConversation.speaker: agent
bmoConversation.text: Executed: $142 provisional credit posted to account. Card *4892 blocked and flagged for reissuance. New card expedited (3 business days). Merchant chargeback filed automatically via Visa network. Customer notification sent via SMS and email.

bmoConversation.speaker: user
bmoConversation.text: Will this disrupt her recurring payments?

bmoConversation.speaker: agent
bmoConversation.text: Recovery protocol initiated. Identified 3 active subscriptions: Netflix ($15.99), Spotify ($10.99), Little Scholars Daycare ($420/mo). All three merchants enrolled in automatic card updater program. New card number pushed to merchant systems within 24 hours. Zero service disruption expected.

bmoConversation.speaker: user
bmoConversation.text: What patterns should I watch for follow-up fraud?

bmoConversation.speaker: agent
bmoConversation.text: Analysis complete. This matches 'card-not-present electronics fraud' pattern — 847 similar cases last 90 days. Techtronix Store flagged as medium-risk merchant (2.1% fraud rate vs 0.8% network avg). Recommendation: Monitor Sarah's account for 72 hours for additional unauthorized attempts. Pattern logged for proactive detection across portfolio.

fraud-focused.speaker: user
fraud-focused.text: Pull up the fraud analysis for case FR-2847.

fraud-focused.speaker: agent
fraud-focused.text: Fraud score: 87/100 (High confidence). Key indicators: Geolocation mismatch (Dallas vs Toronto home), transaction at 2:23 AM local time, merchant flagged with 2.1% fraud rate. Cardholder velocity: Normal. Device fingerprint: New device, not recognized in past 90 days.

fraud-focused.speaker: user
fraud-focused.text: Show me historical fraud patterns for similar transactions.

fraud-focused.speaker: agent
fraud-focused.text: Pattern match: 'Card-Not-Present Electronics Fraud' — 847 similar cases in last 90 days, 94% confirmed fraud. Common merchant categories: Electronics, Tech accessories. Average fraud amount: $156. This merchant (Techtronix) has 23 previous fraud reports, representing 2.8x network average.

fraud-focused.speaker: user
fraud-focused.text: What's the risk if we approve this dispute?

fraud-focused.speaker: agent
fraud-focused.text: Risk assessment: Low. Customer profile clean (zero fraud history, 4.2 years tenure, $87K annual spend). If fraudulent claim: Likelihood <3%. If legitimate fraud: Chargeback win probability 89% based on Visa Rule 4863 criteria and merchant response history. Recommend: Approve with standard monitoring.

fraud-focused.speaker: user
fraud-focused.text: Flag this merchant for enhanced monitoring?

fraud-focused.speaker: agent
fraud-focused.text: Recommendation: Yes. Adding Techtronix Store to watchlist. Enhanced monitoring active for 90 days. All future transactions $100+ will trigger real-time velocity checks and require device verification. Portfolio impact: 12 active cardholders with this merchant, total exposure $1,843.

compliance-focused.speaker: user
compliance-focused.text: Run compliance check on case FR-2847.

compliance-focused.speaker: agent
compliance-focused.text: Regulation E compliance: ✓ Passed. Provisional credit timeline: 2 hours (regulation allows 10 business days). FCBA requirements: ✓ Met. Customer disclosure sent 11/06 14:25 EST via email and SMS. Billing error notice: ✓ Compliant. OCC audit trail: Complete with timestamps and decision points.

compliance-focused.speaker: user
compliance-focused.text: Any documentation gaps or regulatory risks?

compliance-focused.speaker: agent
compliance-focused.text: Documentation status: Complete. Customer statement obtained and timestamped. Card network rule compliance: Visa Rule 4863 (Cardholder Does Not Recognize) — fully satisfied. Required elements: Cardholder denial ✓, Transaction details ✓, Merchant descriptor ✓. Chargeback filing deadline: 120 days from transaction date, currently at day 1.

compliance-focused.speaker: agent
compliance-focused.text: Zero Liability analysis: Qualified ✓. Cardholder notification within 60 days (actual: 2 hours). No cardholder negligence indicators. Card in cardholder possession. No PIN used. Gross negligence test: Negative. Federal liability cap: $50, BMO policy: $0. Customer liability: $0.00. Disclosure compliance: Account agreement section 12.3 applied.

customer-service-focused.speaker: user
customer-service-focused.text: What's Sarah Mitchell's account status and history?

customer-service-focused.speaker: agent
customer-service-focused.text: Customer: Sarah Mitchell, Account since Feb 2020 (4.2 years). Contact preference: SMS primary, email secondary. Last contact: 11/06 14:23 (today, regarding this case). CSAT score: 92/100 (based on 3 previous interactions). Customer sentiment: Satisfied, no escalations in history.

customer-service-focused.speaker: user
customer-service-focused.text: How quickly can we resolve this for her?

customer-service-focused.speaker: agent
customer-service-focused.text: Resolution timeline: Immediate. Provisional credit posted at 14:25 EST (2 minutes after report). Card replacement: Expedited shipping, 3 business days delivery. No service disruption — 3 recurring payments auto-updated within 24 hours. Total customer effort: Single call, 2.1 minute handle time. Follow-up: Confirmation sent, no further action required.

customer-service-focused.speaker: user
customer-service-focused.text: Should I proactively reach out with any additional information?

customer-service-focused.speaker: agent
customer-service-focused.text: Recommendation: Optional proactive touchpoint on day 3. Message: 'Your new card arrives tomorrow. We've automatically updated Netflix, Spotify, and Little Scholars Daycare.' Predicted CSAT impact: +4 points. Alternative: Wait for card delivery, then send 'card activated' confirmation with fraud prevention tips.

operations-focused.speaker: user
operations-focused.text: Show me the operational metrics for this case type.

operations-focused.speaker: agent
operations-focused.text: Case type: Fraudulent Charge (unauthorized CNP). Volume today: 47 cases. Automation rate: 98.4% (46 fully automated, 1 HITL review). Average handle time: 2.1 minutes (vs 18 minutes pre-AI). Cost per case: $3.20 (vs $47.80 traditional). SLA performance: 100% within 24-hour target, actual: 2.3 minute average.

operations-focused.speaker: user
operations-focused.text: What's our chargeback win rate for these cases?

operations-focused.speaker: agent
operations-focused.text: Chargeback performance (90-day window): Win rate: 83.7%. Total cases: 1,247. Won: 1,044. Lost: 187. Pending: 16. Average recovery: $164 per case. Total recovery: $171,216. Primary loss reason: Insufficient documentation (12%), followed by expired filing window (5%). Recommendation: Enhanced merchant evidence collection.

operations-focused.speaker: user
operations-focused.text: Impact on team productivity and cost savings?

operations-focused.speaker: agent
operations-focused.text: Productivity analysis: Agent capacity increased 8.5x (from 2.1 cases/hour to 17.9 cases/hour). Cost reduction: $44.60 per case savings. Quarterly savings projection: $557K (based on 12,500 cases). ROI on AI platform: 847% annualized. Team reallocation: 6 FTEs moved from routine disputes to complex investigations and customer experience.

balanced.text: Show me the details on case #FR-2847 for Sarah Mitchell.

balanced.speaker: agent
balanced.text: Case FR-2847: Unauthorized $142 charge at Techtronix Store detected 11/06 at 14:23 EST. Card ending 4892. Geolocation mismatch — transaction in Dallas, customer home location Toronto. Velocity check passed. Merchant category: Electronics.

balanced.speaker: agent
balanced.text: Dispute valid under Visa Rule 4863 (Cardholder Does Not Recognize). KYC verified, account in good standing. Customer confirmed non-authorization within 2 hours of transaction. Zero prior disputes in 24 months. Recommendation: Approve instant provisional credit.

balanced.speaker: user
balanced.text: Any compliance flags I should know about?

balanced.speaker: agent
balanced.text: No flags. Transaction falls below high-value threshold ($500). Reg E zero liability applies. FCBA provisional credit timeline compliant (within 10 business days, we're at 2 hours). OCC audit trail complete. All disclosures sent to customer automatically.

balanced.speaker: user
balanced.text: Proceed with resolution. What's the full action plan?

balanced.speaker: agent
balanced.text: Executed: $142 provisional credit posted to account. Card *4892 blocked and flagged for reissuance. New card expedited (3 business days). Merchant chargeback filed automatically via Visa network. Customer notification sent via SMS and email.

risk-focused.speaker: user
risk-focused.text: What's the portfolio risk exposure from this case pattern?

risk-focused.speaker: agent
risk-focused.text: Portfolio risk assessment: Techtronix Store pattern identified across 23 transactions, 12 unique cardholders, total exposure $3,247. Risk classification: Medium (2.1% fraud rate vs 0.8% portfolio average). Geographic concentration: 67% Dallas-Fort Worth area. Emerging pattern: Late-night transactions (2-4 AM), average value $141.

risk-focused.speaker: user
risk-focused.text: Show me the financial impact and loss prevention metrics.

risk-focused.speaker: agent
risk-focused.text: Loss prevention performance (YTD): Total fraud prevented: $8.4M. False positive rate: 2.1% (down from 8.7% last year). Detection accuracy: 94.2%. Average detection speed: 4.7 minutes from transaction. Risk score model performance: AUC 0.96. Cost avoidance vs traditional methods: $2.3M annually.

risk-focused.speaker: user
risk-focused.text: What are the emerging threat patterns I should monitor?

risk-focused.speaker: agent
risk-focused.text: Emerging threats (high priority): 1) Synthetic identity fraud up 23% QoQ, 2) Account takeover via SIM swap attacks (+15%), 3) Friendly fraud in subscription services (+8%). Recommended actions: Enhanced identity verification for new accounts, real-time device fingerprinting, merchant category monitoring for subscriptions. Strategic risk level: Low but trending up.

scenarios.title: Duplicate Charge
scenarios.description: Customer charged twice for same service

valueProps.customer: Automatic duplicate detection and instant refund

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Hello Marcus, we detected duplicate charges of $89.99 from 'StreamFlix' within 2 hours. Would you like us to investigate?

conversation.speaker: user
conversation.text: Yes! I only signed up once. Why was I charged twice?

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: I understand your concern. Let me pull up your transaction history and contact the merchant.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Confirmed duplicate charge. Merchant error detected. This qualifies for immediate reversal under billing error protection.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Regulatory check passed. Duplicate charge protection applies per Fair Credit Billing Act.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: $89.99 refunded to your account. Merchant has been notified to prevent future duplicates.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Your StreamFlix subscription remains active with single billing. No action needed on your end.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Case resolved ✅ Pattern logged to identify similar merchant errors automatically.

valueProps.bmo: 83% win rate on travel chargebacks vs. 52% industry avg

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Hi Emily, we see a $425 charge from 'Grand Plaza Hotel' posted yesterday. Everything okay with this transaction?

conversation.speaker: user
conversation.text: No! I cancelled that reservation 2 weeks ago and got a confirmation email.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: That's frustrating. Let me review your cancellation and check the hotel's policy.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Cancellation confirmed 14 days before check-in. Hotel policy allows full refund. Dispute is valid.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Travel protection verified. Merchant violated their own cancellation terms. Proceeding with chargeback.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: $425 credit issued. Formal chargeback filed with hotel. You'll see the refund within 2 business days.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: No recurring payments affected. Your travel card remains active for upcoming trips.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Dispute won ✅ This merchant flagged for closer monitoring on future cancellation disputes.

valueProps.bmo: Prevents $2.3M annual revenue leakage from undetected fraud

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Hi David, we noticed recurring $29.99 monthly charges from 'ProFit Wellness' for the past 6 months. Are you using this service?

conversation.speaker: user
conversation.text: No idea what that is. I've never signed up for any wellness app.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: I'll investigate this immediately and cancel any unauthorized subscriptions.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: No user activity detected on associated account. This appears to be unauthorized recurring billing.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Unauthorized subscription confirmed. Consumer protection laws apply. All charges eligible for reversal.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: $179.94 refunded (6 months × $29.99). Subscription cancelled and merchant blocked from future charges.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: I've added extra fraud alerts to your account to catch similar patterns earlier.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Case closed ✅ This subscription pattern added to early detection models across all customers.

scenarios.title: Proactive Fraud Prevention
scenarios.description: AI stops fraud before customer notices

valueProps.customer: Zero fraud impact with proactive blocking
valueProps.bmo: $8.4M annual fraud loss prevention, 94% pre-auth catch rate

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Hi Jennifer, we just blocked a $2,847 attempted purchase from 'Tech Warehouse Malaysia' on your card. This doesn't match your spending patterns.

conversation.speaker: user
conversation.text: What?! I'm in Toronto and I've never bought anything from Malaysia. Thank you for catching this!

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: You're safe — we stopped it in real-time. Your card has been secured. Let me verify your recent legitimate transactions.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Confirmed fraud attempt. Geolocation mismatch, unusual merchant category, and velocity check flagged this immediately.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Zero liability protection activated per Reg E. Customer has no financial responsibility for attempted fraud.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: New card issued with overnight delivery. Your digital wallet cards are already updated and ready to use.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: I've automatically transferred your 8 recurring payments to your new card. No subscriptions interrupted.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Threat neutralized ✅ This attack pattern shared across network to protect all BMO customers.

valueProps.bmo: Average $112 recovery per case, strengthens premium card value prop

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Hello Raj, we noticed your €500 Paris hotel charge converted to $847 CAD. That's an 18% markup above standard rates.

conversation.speaker: user
conversation.text: Yes! They told me it would be around $700. I feel like I was overcharged.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Let me investigate the exchange rate applied and check the merchant's currency disclosure practices.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Hotel used dynamic currency conversion without proper disclosure. Should have been $720 CAD at interbank rate.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Card network rules violated — merchants must disclose conversion rates. This qualifies for dispute under international transaction protections.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: $127 difference credited back to your account. Full chargeback filed for undisclosed currency markup.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Pro tip: Declining dynamic currency conversion and paying in local currency saves 3-8% on future international purchases.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Case won ✅ This merchant flagged. We'll alert customers about currency conversion options at this location.

valueProps.customer: Real-time elder fraud intervention and recovery
valueProps.bmo: Mitigates reputational risk, saves avg $12K per elder fraud case

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Hi Dorothy, we detected three unusual wire transfers totaling $15,000 to 'Tech Support Services' this week. Is everything okay?

conversation.speaker: user
conversation.text: Yes, the nice man said my computer had viruses and I needed to pay to fix them.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Dorothy, this sounds like a tech support scam. Real companies don't ask for wire transfers. Let me help protect your account immediately.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Pattern matches known elder fraud schemes. Customer was likely coerced. Payments made under false pretenses.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Elder financial abuse protections apply. BMO's duty of care requires intervention and recovery assistance.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Wire transfers recalled — $15,000 recovered. Account secured with enhanced fraud monitoring and family notification option enabled.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: I've added your daughter Lisa as a trusted contact for large transactions. We'll notify her of any unusual activity.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Customer protected ✅ Scam pattern added to real-time detection. We're calling other customers who may be targeted.

valueProps.bmo: Reduces 18-day avg resolution to 2 days, improves NPS +23pts

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Hi Patricia, we see a $2,340 charge from City Medical Center. Your insurance typically covers these expenses. Would you like us to investigate?

conversation.speaker: user
conversation.text: Yes please! My insurance said they covered it, but the hospital still charged my card. I'm so confused.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Medical billing can be stressful. Let me coordinate with both your insurance and the hospital to sort this out for you.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Insurance paid $1,890 but hospital double-billed. Coordination of benefits error. Customer should owe $0 after insurance.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Medical billing regulations reviewed. Hospital violated balance billing protections. Customer has legal protections here.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: $2,340 credited immediately. We're contacting the hospital's billing department directly to resolve the insurance coordination error.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: We've documented everything for your records. If the hospital contacts you, just refer them to BMO's dispute department.

conversation.speaker: agent
conversation.text: Issue resolved ✅ This hospital's billing system flagged. We'll expedite future insurance disputes from this provider.

agents.name: Fraud Sentinel
agents.reasoning: Analyzes transaction patterns, location data, and spending behavior to identify anomalies before customers notice them.

agents.name: Outreach
agents.reasoning: Engages customers with empathetic, natural language to confirm identity and gather dispute context efficiently.

agents.name: Eligibility
agents.reasoning: Verifies KYC status, merchant reputation, transaction metadata, and card network rules to determine dispute validity.

agents.name: Compliance Guard
agents.reasoning: Cross-references decisions against OCC, FINRA, Visa/Mastercard regulations, and internal policies to ensure zero audit risk.

agents.name: Resolution
agents.reasoning: Processes provisional credits, blocks compromised cards, triggers reissuance, and orchestrates backend systems automatically.

agents.name: Recovery
agents.reasoning: Identifies recurring payment relationships and proactively reconnects trusted merchants to prevent service disruption.

agents.name: Learning
agents.reasoning: Captures case features and outcomes to retrain fraud detection models, creating a continuous improvement loop.
